conbody.p: Small C library support in GCC is provided via new multi-lib configurations. Pre-built small/tiny libraries variants are provided with the toolchain for select multi-lib combinations.

The Small C library is provided within the toolchain as a set of three static library files, for both small and tiny variants. At the least, the toolchain installation will contain the files mentioned below:

table.title: Essential files in small C library

row.entry: ISO conforming size optimized string, memory, IO, time and other functions.
ISO conforming size optimized Math functions.
ISO conforming size optimized string, memory, IO, time and other functions, compiled with debugging enabled
Non-conforming size optimized string, memory, IO, time and other functions
Non-conforming size optimized string, memory, IO, time and other functions, compiled with debugging enabled

conbody.p: Based on the actual combinations of multilib that the toolchain is built with, there may be multiple versions of these libraries â€“ each having been compiled using a unique combination of compiler options and located within a directory structure determined by the corresponding multi-lib configuration. The libraries listed above correspond to a little-endian, soft-float build for the nanoMIPS32R6 architecture.
